kubejs.ponder.aimer.text_1: Weapon Aimer can be used to aim any placeable weaponary from Warium, including...
kubejs.ponder.aimer.text_10: For Rocket Pod it's front part
kubejs.ponder.aimer.text_7: And Armor Peeler or Fire Spear Rocket Pod
kubejs.ponder.aimer.text_8: Right-click weapon or it's main part with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.aimer.text_9: For rockets main part is Ordinance Core
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_1: Aimer Node creates 13x7x13 zone around it
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_10: Same logic goes for the rockets, but with Ordinance Core
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_2: Any stationary weapon from Warium in this zone will automatically connect to Aimer Node
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_3: While holding Weapon Aimer in second hand, right click Aimer Node to connect it
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_4: You can now change pitch and yaw values of all weapons in the area at the same time
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_5: And while you changing them, shooting trajectory is displayed
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_6: For Countermeasure Launcher and Smoke Launcher trajectory is not displaying for some reason
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_7: Node Trigger can shoot or activate any weaponary from Warium if located in the Aimer Node coverage area and placed next to the object
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_8: For Rocket Pod it must be placed next to the Armor Peeler Rocket Pod
kubejs.ponder.aimer_node.text_9: If Trigger placed next to the Rocket Pod Chamber it won't work
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_1: Artillery Barrel is required for Artillery Cannon to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_10: And Artillery Charge Autoloader from the side
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_11: Artillery Charge Autoloader must be facing Artillery Cannon breech to connect
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_12: Facing direction is always pointing to the side that player was standing when it was placed
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_13: Hoppers or any other modded item suppliers can be connected both to shell and charge loaders
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_14: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_2: Artillery Cannon shoots different types of Artillery Shells
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 12 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_7: Artillery Cannon has unique ammunition loading process...
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_8: Propellant must be loaded after the shell in order to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillery_barrel.text_9: Alternatively, Artillery Cannon Autoloader can be placed below Artillery Cannon
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_1: Artillery Cannon shoots different types of Artillery Shells
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_10: And Artillery Charge Autoloader from the side
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_11: Artillery Charge Autoloader must be facing Artillery Cannon breech to connect
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_12: Facing direction is always pointing to the side that player was standing when it was placed
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_13: Hoppers or any other modded item suppliers can be connected both to shell and charge loaders
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_14: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_2: Artillery Barrel is required to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 12 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_7: Artillery Cannon has unique ammunition loading process...
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_8: Propellant must be loaded after the shell in order to shoot
kubejs.ponder.artillerybreech.text_9: Alternatively, Artillery Cannon Autoloader can be placed below Artillery Cannon
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_1: Heavy Auto Cannon shoots Medium Shells
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_2: Autocannon Barrel is required to shoot
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 6 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_7: To insert shells in Heavy Auto Cannon, Autocannon Drum should be placed on top
kubejs.ponder.autocannon.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.autocannon_barrel.text_1: Rotary Autocannon Barrel is required for 2 types of Auto Cannons
kubejs.ponder.battle_cannon_barrel.text_: Battle Cannon Barrel is required for Battle Cannon to shoot
Redstone signal is needed to shoot
Battle Cannon shoots different types of Large Shells
Barrel can be extended up to 11 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Alternatively, Battle Cannon Autoloader can be placed below Battle Cannon
Hoppers or any other modded item suppliers can be connected to it
kubejs.ponder.battle_cannon_breech.text_: Battle Cannon shoots different types of Large Shells
Redstone signal is needed to shoot
Battle Cannon Barrel is required to shoot
Barrel can be extended up to 11 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Alternatively, Battle Cannon Autoloader can be placed below Battle Cannon
Hoppers or any other modded item suppliers can be connected to it
kubejs.ponder.blast_funnel.text_1: Blast Funnels are used to build Alloy Furnace
kubejs.ponder.blast_funnel.text_2: 3 Blast Funnels must be ontop of the Alloy Furnace
kubejs.ponder.blast_funnel.text_6: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.blast_funnel.text_8: Even if Alloy Furnace is idle
kubejs.ponder.blast_funnel.text_9: There are also more efficient alternatives to Firebox...
kubejs.ponder.blast_furnace.text_1: Alloy Furnace mixes ore dusts into alloyed ingots
kubejs.ponder.blast_furnace.text_10: There are also more efficient alternatives to Firebox...
kubejs.ponder.blast_furnace.text_7: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.blast_furnace.text_9: Even if Alloy Furnace is idle
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_1: First step to start the reactor, is to warm it up with Uranium Fuel Rods
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_2: Put 1 Uranium Fuel Rod into each Empty Fuel Rods Section
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_3: Now that each section has consumed first rod for warmup...
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_5: Each section can hold up to 4 rods
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_6: One rod powers the reactor for 50 minutes
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_7: Once all sections have started working, enriched material can be inputted
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_8: It takes 6 minutes and 40 seconds to process 1 item
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor.text_9: Output will appear in Breeder Reactor Port
Breeder Reactor Interface is used to input items in the breeder reactor
Breeder reactor consists of 4 main parts
Chamber part consists of 3 blocks too
kubejs.ponder.breeder_reactor_port.text_: Breeder Reactor Port is used to output items from the breeder reactor
Breeder reactor consists of 4 main parts
Chamber part consists of 3 blocks too
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_bottom.text_1: Centrifuge Bottom outputs Depleted Uranium Dust from the centrifuge
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_bottom.text_5: And 8 Giant Coils from the sides
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_bottom.text_6: Centrifuge processes 1 dust for 3 minutes and 20 seconds
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_bottom.text_7: Enriched material will output in Centrifuge Top
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_bottom.text_8: And for Uranium, Depleted Uranium Dust in Centrifuge Bottom
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_core.text_1: Centrifuge Core is the main part of the centrifuge
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_core.text_5: And 8 Giant Coils from the sides
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_core.text_6: Centrifuge processes 1 dust for 3 minutes and 20 seconds
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_core.text_7: Enriched material will output in Centrifuge Top
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_core.text_8: And for Uranium, Depleted Uranium Dust in Centrifuge Bottom
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_top.text_1: Centrifuge Top outputs enriched material from the centrifuge
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_top.text_5: And 8 Giant Coils from the sides
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_top.text_6: Centrifuge processes 1 dust for 3 minutes and 20 seconds
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_top.text_7: Enriched material will output in Centrifuge Top
kubejs.ponder.centrifuge_top.text_8: And for Uranium, Depleted Uranium Dust in Centrifuge Bottom
kubejs.ponder.conveyor.text_1: Conveyor can be used to output items from different machines
kubejs.ponder.conveyor.text_2: Item transportation chains can be constructed using different conveyor types
kubejs.ponder.conveyor.text_3: Hoppers or any other modded item transporters then can be used to extract items from conveyor
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_dropoff.text_1: Conveyor Dropoff works similar to Conveyor
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_dropoff.text_2: The only defference is that it immediately drops any collected items
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_dropoff2.text_1: Conveyor Dropoff works similar to Conveyor as well
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_dropoff2.text_2: The only defference is that it immediately drops any collected items
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift.text_1: Conveyor lift works similar to Conveyor
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift.text_2: The only defference is that it moves items vertically
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift.text_3: Items can be inputted using conveyors from the sides
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift2.text_1: Conveyor lift works similar to Conveyor as well
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift2.text_2: The only defference is that it moves items vertically
kubejs.ponder.conveyor_lift2.text_3: Items can be inputted using conveyors from the sides
kubejs.ponder.countermeasure_dispenser.t: Countermeasure Launcher can launch and store up to 9 flares at a time
Meanwhile, flares can be used as a countermeasure to IR missles
Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.crusher.text_1: For Automatic Crusher to work, rotation force must be provided from the side
kubejs.ponder.cutter.text_1: Automatic Shear has 2 requirements to work
kubejs.ponder.cutter.text_2: Conveyor must be placed at the front
kubejs.ponder.cutter.text_3: Lift or dropoff variant can be used
kubejs.ponder.cutter.text_4: And rotation force must be provided from the side
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_1: Large Engine Drive Shaft is used to build large combustion engine
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_10: Up to 8 sections can be stacked to to increase the power
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_11: Each section requires redstone signal individually
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_12: And each section must be connected to Fuel Tank individually
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_4: Fuel Tank is needed to provide the fuel
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_5: Right click with Diesel Bucket to fill Fuel Tank with diesel
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_6: Use Fuel Hose to connect Fuel Tank to the engine
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_7: Redstone signal should be used to turn the engine on
kubejs.ponder.drive_shaft.text_8: One large engine section produces the same amount of rotation force as light combustion engine
kubejs.ponder.electric_firebox.text_1: Electric Firebox produces heat from electricity
kubejs.ponder.electric_firebox.text_2: Electric Firebox can be used for Foundry
kubejs.ponder.electric_firebox.text_6: it must be powered to work
kubejs.ponder.empty_missile_hardpoint.te: Medium Rocket Hardpoint is used for mounting and launching medium-sized rockets and missiles
Redstone signal is needed launch the missile
kubejs.ponder.energy_node.text_1: Energy Nodes are used to transfer electricity
kubejs.ponder.energy_node.text_2: Rotation Generator generates power from rotation
kubejs.ponder.energy_node.text_3: Electric Motor converts power back to rotation
kubejs.ponder.energy_node.text_5: Energy Distribution Node can be used to connect multiple Energy Nodes
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_1: Large Engine Cyllinder is used to build large combustion engine
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_10: Up to 8 sections can be stacked to to increase the power
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_11: Each section requires redstone signal individually
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_12: And each section must be connected to Fuel Tank individually
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_4: Fuel Tank is needed to provide the fuel
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_5: Right click with Diesel Bucket to fill Fuel Tank with diesel
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_6: Use Fuel Hose to connect Fuel Tank to the engine
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_7: Redstone signal should be used to turn the engine on
kubejs.ponder.engine_cyllinder.text_8: One large engine section produces the same amount of rotation force as light combustion engine
kubejs.ponder.extruder.text_2: Conveyor must be placed at the front
kubejs.ponder.extruder.text_3: Lift or dropoff variant can be used
kubejs.ponder.extruder.text_4: And rotation force must be provided from the side
kubejs.ponder.firebox.text_1: Firebox produces heat from coal and is needed for different resource procesing structures
kubejs.ponder.firebox.text_8: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.firebox_electric_firebox.t: Electric Firebox produces heat from electricity
it must be powered to work
kubejs.ponder.firebox_oil_firebox.text_1: Kerosene Firebox produces heat from Kerosene and is optional instead of regular Firebox
kubejs.ponder.firebox_oil_firebox.text_2: it consumes Kerosene instead of Coal
kubejs.ponder.firebox_oil_firebox.text_3: 1 Kerosene bucket keeps it working for 4 minutes and 10 seconds (stacks if more added)
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_1: Foundry casts materials into certain components
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_2: Firebox must be below in order to work
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_5: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_8: There are also more efficient alternatives to Firebox...
kubejs.ponder.fuel_tank.text_1: Fuel Tank can contain 1 bucket of any fuel
kubejs.ponder.fuel_tank.text_2: Fuel Tanks placed next to each other are automatically connected
kubejs.ponder.fuel_tank.text_3: Right click with Diesel Bucket to fill Fuel Tank with diesel
kubejs.ponder.fuel_tank.text_4: Fuel Tank Connection Port must be used to output fuel
kubejs.ponder.fuel_tank.text_5: Use Fuel Hose to connect Fuel Tank Connection Port to varios machines
kubejs.ponder.fusion_bomb.text_1: Fusion Bomb is the most powerful weapon in Warium
kubejs.ponder.fusion_bomb.text_2: It must be filled with 6x Implosion Lens and 1x Fission Core in order to be ready for an activation
kubejs.ponder.fusion_bomb.text_4: Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.giant_coil.text_1: Giant Coils are used to build centrifuge
kubejs.ponder.giant_coil.text_2: Dust should be put into Centrifuge Core
kubejs.ponder.giant_coil.text_3: Enriched material will output in Centrifuge Top
kubejs.ponder.giant_coil.text_4: And for Uranium, Depleted Uranium Dust in Centrifuge Bottom
kubejs.ponder.giant_coil.text_5: Centrifuge processes 1 dust for 3 minutes and 20 seconds
kubejs.ponder.large_engine_smokestack.te: Large Engine Smokestack is used to build large combustion engine
Up to 8 sections can be stacked to to increase the power
Each section requires redstone signal individually
And each section must be connected to Fuel Tank individually
Fuel Tank is needed to provide the fuel
Right click with Diesel Bucket to fill Fuel Tank with diesel
Use Fuel Hose to connect Fuel Tank to the engine
Redstone signal should be used to turn the engine on
One large engine section produces the same amount of rotation force as light combustion engine
kubejs.ponder.large_rocket_pod_chamber.t: Large Rocket Pod Chamber is needed to build complete Fire Spear Rocket Pod
Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Redstone signal must power Armor Peeler Rocket Pod part to launch rocket
kubejs.ponder.lathe.text_1: Automatic Lathe has 2 requirements to work
kubejs.ponder.lathe.text_2: Conveyor must be placed at the front
kubejs.ponder.lathe.text_3: Lift or dropoff variant can be used
kubejs.ponder.lathe.text_4: And rotation force must be provided from the side
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_1: Light Auto Cannon shoots Small Shells
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_2: Autocannon Barrel is required to shoot
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 6 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_7: To insert shells in Light Auto Cannon, Autocannon Drum should be placed on top
kubejs.ponder.light_autocannon.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.light_combustion_engine.te: Light Combustion Engine produces rotation force using diesel
Fuel Tank is needed to provide the fuel
Right click with Diesel Bucket to fill Fuel Tank with diesel
Use Fuel Hose to connect Fuel Tank to the engine
Redstone signal should be used to turn the engine on
Rotation can be used to power multiple machines
Extension Shafts can be used to extend the rotation further
Or it can be converted to electricity using Rotation Generator
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_2: Machine Gun Barrel is required to shoot
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_3: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_4: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_5: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_6: To insert bullets in Machine Gun, Machine Gun Ammunition Box must be used
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_7: Hold Ammunition Box in main hand and Large Bullets in second
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_8: Right click to put bullets in the box
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_1: Machine Gun Barrel is required for Machine Gun to shoot
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_3: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_4: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_5: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_6: To insert bullets in Machine Gun, Machine Gun Ammunition Box must be used
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_7: Hold Ammunition Box in main hand and Large Bullets in second
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_8: Right click to put bullets in the box
kubejs.ponder.machine_gun_barrel.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.manual_aimer.text_1: Manual Aiming Handle combines the functions of Aimer Node, Node Trigger and Weapon Aimer
kubejs.ponder.manual_aimer.text_2: If placed next to any weapon that can be aimed...
kubejs.ponder.manual_aimer.text_3: Player can aim the weapon in direction they are looking and shoot with left mouse click while using the Manual Aiming Handle
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_1: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_10: Higher pitch shot is more accurate, but projectile takes longer to reach the end point
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_2: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_3: Pitch is responsible for the vertical angle of the projectile shot and therefore the coverage distance
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_4: While yaw is responsible for the left/right rotation
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_8: Conclusion: 0 pitch has the longest range. Both above and below 0 pitch decreases the distance
kubejs.ponder.mortar.text_9: Lower pitch results in a less accurate shot, but projectile reaches the final destination faster
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_1: Node Trigger can shoot or activate any weaponary from Warium if located in the Aimer Node coverage area and placed next to the object
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_10: For Countermeasure Launcher and Smoke Launcher trajectory is not displaying for some reason
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_2: For Rocket Pod it must be placed next to the Armor Peeler Rocket Pod
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_3: If Trigger placed next to the Rocket Pod Chamber it won't work
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_4: Same logic goes for the rockets, but with Ordinance Core
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_5: Aimer Node creates 13x7x13 zone around it
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_6: Any stationary weapon from Warium in this zone will automatically connect to Aimer Node
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_7: While holding Weapon Aimer in second hand, right click Aimer Node to connect it
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_8: You can now change pitch and yaw values of all weapons in the area at the same time
kubejs.ponder.node_trigger.text_9: And while you changing them, shooting trajectory is displayed
kubejs.ponder.oil_firebox.text_1: Kerosene Firebox produces heat from Kerosene and is optional instead of regular Firebox
kubejs.ponder.oil_firebox.text_2: Kerosene Firebox can be used for Foundry
kubejs.ponder.oil_firebox.text_6: it consumes Kerosene instead of Coal
kubejs.ponder.oil_firebox.text_7: 1 Kerosene bucket keeps it working for 4 minutes and 10 seconds (stacks if more added)
Ordinance Cluster Warhead Nose is used for building rockets and bombs that split into multiple small bombs
Fins is used for Cluster Bomb
Truster is used for horizontal Cluster Rocket
Weapon Aimer can be used to change both rockets direction
Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the rocket/bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_core.text_1: Ordinance Core is used for all rockets from Warium
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_core.text_2: Weapon Aimer can be used to change rocket direction
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_core.text_3: Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_core.text_4: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_core.text_5: Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the rocket/bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_fins.text_1: Ordinance Fins is used only for bombs
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_fins.text_2: Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_fission_initiato: Ordinance Kinetic Nose is used to build a droppable Fission Bomb
Ordinance Core Fission Bomb is the main part
It must be filled with 6x Implosion Lens and 1x Fission Core in order to be ready for an activation
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_heavy_warhead.te: Ordinance Nose Warhead is used for building high explosive shrapnel rockets and bombs
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the the rocket/bomb to launch it
Fins is used for Heavy Bomb
Truster is used for horizontal Heavy Rocket
Heavy Bomb can be additionally modified by Ordinance Core Warhead
Or even by TWO Ordinance Core Warheads!
Weapon Aimer can be used to change both rockets direction
Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in the second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_incendiary_warhe: Ordinance Fire Nose Warhead is used for building incendiary rockets and bombs
Fins is used for Fire Bomb
Truster is used for horizontal Incendiary Rocket
Weapon Aimer can be used to change both rockets direction
Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the rocket/bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_inline_fission_w: Ordinance Core Fission Bomb is the main part of the droppable Fission Bomb
It needs to be filled with 6x Implosion Lens and 1x Fission Core in order to be ready for an activation
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_inline_warhead.t: Ordinance Core Warhead is only required for a Bunker Buster Bomb
But can also be used for a Heavy Bomb to make it heavier
Second Ordinance Core Warhead can be added to make it even heavier
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_ir_seeker_head.t: Ordinance IR Seeker is used for missiles that use the infrared (IR) light emission to track and follow the target
Thruster is used in both cases
Weapon Aimer can be used to change both horizontal or vertical rocket direction
Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the rocket to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_ir_seeker_sim.te: IR rocket will follow any high enough heat source once launched
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_kinetic_head.tex: Ordinance Kinetic Nose is used for "Bunker Buster" high penetration bombs
This is the only bomb which strictly requires Ordinance Core Warhead
Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the bomb to launch it
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_kinetic_head_sim: If Bunker Buster bomb hits solid ground...
It just creates a pretty deep impact crater
Bunker Buster bomb can drill up to 5 blocks down
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_1: Ordinance Thruster is used only for rockets
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_4: Vertical rockets by default will fly to the side that player was standing when Ordinance Core was placed
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_5: Weapon Aimer can be used to change both horizontal or vertical rocket direction
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_6: Right-click Ordinance Core with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_7: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.ordinance_thruster.text_8: Redstone signal must power Ordinance Core part of the rocket to launch it
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_1: First step to start the reactor, is to warm it up with Uranium Fuel Rods
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_2: Put 1 Uranium Fuel Rod into each Empty Fuel Rods Section
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_3: Now that each section has consumed first rod for warmup...
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_5: Each section can hold up to 4 rods
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_6: One rod powers the reactor for 50 minutes
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_7: Once all sections have started working, power generation will begin
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor.text_8: Electricity will be outputted through Power Reactor Port
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor_interface.te: Power Reactor Interface is used to build power reactor
Power reactor consists of 4 main parts
Chamber part consists of 3 blocks too
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor_port.text_1: Power Reactor Port outputs power from power reactor
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor_port.text_2: Power reactor consists of 4 main parts
kubejs.ponder.power_reactor_port.text_7: Chamber part consists of 3 blocks too
kubejs.ponder.press.text_1: Automatic Press has 2 requirements to work
kubejs.ponder.press.text_2: Conveyor must be placed at the front
kubejs.ponder.press.text_3: Lift or dropoff variant can be used
kubejs.ponder.press.text_4: And rotation force must be provided from the side
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_1: Rotary Autocannon Barrel is required for Rotary Auto Cannon to shoot
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_2: Rotary Auto Cannon shoots Small Shells
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 5 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_7: To insert shells in Rotary Auto Cannon, Autocannon Drum should be placed on top
kubejs.ponder.rac_barrel.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_1: Oil Refinery turns Shale Oil into various fuels
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_10: Even if Oil Refinery is idle
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_11: There are also more efficient alternatives to Firebox...
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_3: 4 Oil Refinery Tower sections must be ontop
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_5: Each Oil Refinery Tower section will produce different type of fuel
kubejs.ponder.refinery.text_8: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_1: Oil Refinery Tower is used to build Oil Refinery
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_10: There are also more efficient alternatives to Firebox...
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_2: 4 Oil Refinery Tower sections are required for Oil Refinery to work
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_4: Each Oil Refinery Tower section will produce different type of fuel
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_7: Firebox starts working as soon as there is fuel in it
kubejs.ponder.refinery_tower.text_9: Even if Oil Refinery is idle
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod.text_1: Fire Spear Rocket Pod can launch and store up to 4 Fire Spear Rockets at a time
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod.text_3: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod.text_4: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod.text_5: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod.text_6: Redstone signal must power Armor Peeler Rocket Pod part to launch rocket
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod_chamber.text_1: Rocket Pod Chamber is used to build complete Rocket Pod
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod_chamber.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod_chamber.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod_chamber.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.rocket_pod_chamber.text_7: Redstone signal must power Armor Peeler Rocket Pod part to launch rocket
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_1: Rotary Auto Cannon shoots Small Shells
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_2: Rotary Autocannon Barrel is required to shoot
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_3: Barrel can be extended up to 5 blocks long to increase shooting accuracy and distance
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_4: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_5: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach it
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_6: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_7: To insert shells in Rotary Auto Cannon, Autocannon Drum should be placed on top
kubejs.ponder.rotary_auto_cannon.text_9: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.smoke_launcher.text_1: Weapon Aimer can be used to change shooting direction
kubejs.ponder.smoke_launcher.text_2: Right-click with Weapon Aimer in second hand to attach
kubejs.ponder.smoke_launcher.text_3: LEFT/RIGHT arrow for yaw UP/DOWN arrow for pitch
kubejs.ponder.smoke_launcher.text_4: Redstone signal is needed to shoot
kubejs.ponder.solar_generator.text_1: Solar Generators can produce electricity during the day
kubejs.ponder.solar_generator.text_2: Energy can be stored in Energy Batteries...
kubejs.ponder.solar_generator.text_3: Or be directly outputted using Energy Nodes
